SIDE HUSTLE INTERNSHIP 3.0

SH-IT-14453

Best Life Quote:
"A dream is a destination but hardwork is the journey"

KIDA THE GREAT

2002 - Present

To The Boy Who Became The Best Dancer In The World By Seventeen

OUTSET

Leon "Kida" Burns (born April 8, 2002), better known by his stage name Kida The Great, is an American hip-hop dancer, choreographer and actor. Burns' first teacher was his oldest brother, Shaheem Sanchez Burns, who started mentoring him when he was 4. He was also inspired by various dance films, which he watched with his father. His father died in 2014.

BREAKTHROUGH

At age 11, Burns began training at Chapkis Dance Studio in Suisun City, California under So You Think You Can Dance Season 1 contestant Greg Chapkis. In 2015, Burns performed solo on The Queen Latifah Show and The Rachel Ray Show, which caught the attention of So You Think You Can Dance producers. In 2016, Burns claimed the grand prize of $250,000 when he was voted America's Favorite Dancer on the thirteenth season of So You Think You Can Dance: Next Generation.

ACCOLADES

Burns has made apperances in numerous music videos from hip-hop legends such as Chris Brown, Justin Bieber, Usher; just to mention a few. He has also made mind blowing performances at concerts, The World Of Dance Competition, B.E.T. Events e.t.c. Garnered a massive following on Instagram and YouTube. Truly he is one of the best dancers of his generation and at such a young age as well. Makes you wonder what He'll be able to achieve by 30, 40 and beyond.
